Comments_List: Learning to edit others as well as my own work.
The basic structure of a narrative, thinking like a writer (pinpointing what i believe to be mistakes with evidence from the text), sharing my opinion in an academic setting .

I learned to analyze fiction through the eyes of a creative writer which added to being able to analyze fiction in general. I also learned how to structure a story, how to form character, setting, and a plot. I also learned the do's and don't's of creative writing like what to avoid and what to expand on.

Strengths: Mr. Sexton, the readings, assignments, workshopping activities, small class size
Weakness: Maybe I wanted more of 1:1 meetings with Mr. Sexton as a part of the workshopping activity.
No major weaknesses, good, focused semester. Obviously felt rushed but its a 5 week course so thats not anyones fault.
I thought it was great, no improvements necessary!

Yes, definitely, especially to beginning fiction writers. This course makes the student learn all the basics of the craft in a very fun, interactive way. Even for non-writers like myself I would recommend it just because of how insightful it is to writing generally and how fun and light this course is to the mind and heart alongside that.
Yes!! I loved it. Prof is great and getting to write a story is great.
Yes definitely. If you've always wondered about creative writing this is a great way to figure out if it's something you want to do in the future.
